flawed_nl_solution:
Harper collected 30% more than Maggie's 50 pieces of candy, so she collected 0.3*50 = <<30*0.01*50=15>>15 more pieces of candy
Maggie has 50 pieces and Harper collected 15 more than her, so she has 50+15 = <<50+15=65>>65 pieces of candy
Neil collected 40% more than Harper, who has 65 pieces, so that's 0.4*65 = 62 more pieces of candy
Harper has 65 pieces and Neil collected 62 more than her, so he has 65+62 = <<65+62=127>>127 pieces of candy
#### 127

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 26, not 62. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
